explains: n. 奇迹，奇观；（尤指年幼的）奇才，神童；奇事，异兆

sentences.en: She was a child prodigy, giving concerts before she was a teenager.
sentences.cn: 她小时候是个神童，十三岁以前就在音乐会上登台表演了。

sentences.en: For further information on the life of William James Sidis, see Amy Wallace, "The Prodigy."
sentences.cn: 要了解更多关于威廉·詹姆斯·西迪斯的生平，参阅艾米·华莱士的《神童》。

sentences.en: The Russian tennis prodigy is well on the way to becoming the youngest world champion of all time.
sentences.cn: 这位俄罗斯网球奇才已很有望成为历史上最年轻的世界冠军。
